name: Sautéed Kale
description: This is a technique that elevates basic sauteed greens into something even more savory and tender.
keywords: dairy-free, vegan, vegetarian, kale, side dish
recipeIngredient: 1 large bunch kale, stemmed, with leaves coarsely chopped
1/2 cup vegetable stock, white wine or water
Kosher salt, freshly ground black pepper and red-pepper flakes to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil in a large sauté pan set over medium-high heat until it shimmers. Add garlic, and cook until soft.

Add kale to the pan, turn the heat to high and add the stock. Use a spoon to toss the greens in the oil
and stock, then cover and cook for approximately 5 to 7 minutes, until it is soft and wilted, but still quite
green. Remove cover and continue to cook, stirring occasionally until all the liquid has evaporated, another 1 to 2 minutes. Season to taste with salt and peppers, add vinegar and toss to combine.
